tier.item: kutirkUchir] huk umallantashi chunka ishkayta yupaykun.
`Then the cat, repeatedly removing the head from the saddlebag and
returning it, counts the one head twelve times.' (Weber 1989:323)1
kutirkUchir] huk umallantashi chunka ishkayta yupaykun.
Then the cat, repeatedly removing the head from the saddlebag and
returning it, counts the one head twelve times.' (Weber 1989:323)1
`I want the potatoes that Marya bought.'
I want the potatoes that Marya bought.
Sumie wa inu o nadete ------ neko o tataita
Sumie top dog acc pat ------ cat acc hit
`Sumie patted the dog and hit the cat.'
Sumie wa inu o nadete------neko o tataita
Sumie top dog acc pat------cat acc hit
Sumie patted the dog and hit the cat.
Sumie wa inu o nadete Taro wa ------ tataita
`Sumie top dog acc pat Taro top ------ hit
`Sumie patted and Taro hit the dog.'
Sumie wa inu o nadete Taro wa------tataita
Sumie top dog acc pat Taro top------hit
Sumie patted and Taro hit the dog.
Sumie wa inu o ------ Norio wa ki o mita
Sumie top dog acc ------ Norio top tree acc saw
`Sumie saw the dog and Norio the tree.'
Sumie wa inu o------Norio wa ki o mita
Sumie top dog acc------Norio top tree acc saw
Sumie saw the dog and Norio the tree.
Wh-clausal pied piping and feature percolation
(44) [ ima-tai wawa ti miku-chun-ta]k Maria tk muna-n QUECHUA
`What does Maria want that the child eat?' (Hermon 1984)
Wh-clausal pied piping and feature percolation
[ ima-tai wawa ti miku-chun-ta]k Maria tk muna-n QUECHUA
What does Maria want that the child eat?' (Hermon 1984)
"I served food to the old man."
I served food to the old man.
"The old man was served food by me."
The old man was served food by me.
137. can-gai wawa cuintu-ta villa-shca-chu ca-rca-ngui (cani) shamu-shpa
you-Top child story-Acc tell-Pas-Q be-Past-2.Sg you come-Cor
"Were you told the story by the child when you came?"
can-gai wawa cuintu-ta villa-shca-chu ca-rca-ngui (cani) shamu-shpa
you-Top child story-Acc tell-Pas-Q be-Past-2.Sg you come-Cor
Were you told the story by the child when you came?
(2) a. wa Ôu-nqa-paq- mi 'It will die (I assert)' Quechua

c. wa Ôu-nqa-paq- chi 'It will die (perhaps)'

Ñuka wawki mana jatun wasi-ta char i-n-chu.
my brother NEG big house-ACC have-3-NONF
`My brother does not have a big house.'

my brother NEG big house-ACC have-3-NONF
